Activity 1.1: Upgrading and modernization of the meteorological and hydrological Observation System. Action: Upgrading/automation of 25 meteorological observation stations and equipment Action: Modernization of the ground-based infrastructure for 2 upper-air stations Action: Installation of 2 online X-band Doppler radar systems to cover current gaps in mountainous areas infrastructures Action: Upgrading and technical equipment of 90 hydrological stations and establishing benchmarks and up to date equipment for instrument calibration
Activity 1.2: Upgrading Uzhydromet capacity to store, process and develop hazard products, as well as to communicate hydrometeorological data to regional divisions.
Activity 2.1: Developing and installing a modernized and efficient system for assessing climate risks based on dynamic information on both hazards and vulnerabilities, including socio-economic risk models for decision making and prioritization of resilience-building long-term/future investments Action: Installation of hardware and software to enable the building of an advanced, impact-based information management system to operationally assess the risks associated with each hazard forecast Action: Identification of set of feasible ex-ante actions for different lead times, based on evaluated risks and the skill of each impact-based forecast Action: Develop of the software and standard operating procedures to automatically ingest hydrological and meteorological observations, weather and other forecasts into the system to be combined with available vulnerability data Action: Capacity building of MES staff on risk assessment, operations and maintenance of the systems Activity 3.1: Establishing National Framework for Climate Services for Uzbekistan Action: Assessment of gaps, needs and user perspectives (i.e., through interviews) concerning the current and desirable climate services Action: Drafting of NFCS Uzbekistan concept and action plan based on the assessment Action: Extensive consultations regarding the concept with the various sectors, users and co-producers of climate services and reaching a broad agreement and Governmental endorsement for NFCS implementation Action: Establishing and supporting the National Climate Outlook Forum as one mechanism to help shape and deliver climate services with a longer time horizon

Due to the late start of the project, the planned results were shifted to Y 2022. In 2021, the project managed to initiate the recruitment process of the project team, and organizing preparation for the Inception workshop,development of the Inception report and Annual project review report as per GCF requirement.
